Paragraph: BACKGROUND : Combined hepatitis B immune globulin ( HBIg ) and lamivudine in prophylaxis of the recurrence of hepatitis B after liver transplantation has significantly improved the survival of HBsAg positive patients .

| Chemical |
| --- |
| hepatitis B immune globulin (HBIg) |
| lamivudine |

Explanation:

1. Hepatitis B immune globulin (HBIg) - This is a preparation of antibodies against the hepatitis B virus, used to provide temporary protection against hepatitis B infection.
2. Lamivudine - This is an antiviral medication used to treat chronic hepatitis B. It works by blocking the action of the virus that causes hepatitis B.
